file_content.text: That's for Koplin and Trace. Good men. Brave men.
I'm sure he had that coming for a long time.
Zane deserved to die.
Wouldn't surprise me.
You've had your revenge. Now let's get going.
Are you finished?
Right.
You're sure you two won't tell anyone about this?
This doesn't get out, right?
Absolutely, sir.
Let's get you two back to your squad. They'll want to know you're okay. I'll call for an evac.
They're off, sir. Mission accomplished.
I know it was hard, but you did the right thing.
I'm proud of you.
Who knows how many more soldiers Zane would have sent to their deaths? You ended all that.
You did a good thing.
You doing alright?
Are you okay?
Zane was scum. He deserved to die.
Stop pouting.
You were out of line back there.
You almost lost it.
I know.
Honestly, I'd rather not talk about it right now, sir. Let's just get out of here.
Berix, Hal--you two still breathing?
Ugh... more or less. Didn't expect to see you here, sir.
Nor I. Care to tell me what you two are doing here?
We're rescuing the Deadeyes. Play nice and maybe we'll let you tag along.
That should be obvious.
Maybe I don't want to be rescued.
What are you doing here?
I could ask you the same.
My job.
I'm sorry, am I getting in the way of your prison time?
There's gratitude for you.
Yes.
Don't you get it? This operation was never about rescuing POWs. We've been after one thing--Dusk 9.
Impossible. That place is just a myth.
Is it? We'll never know now, thanks to you two.
If that's true, then you lied to the Deadeyes about their mission's real objective.
You kept us all in the dark.
Of course. We could hardly expect a bunch of grunts to keep their mouths shut.
I must be missing something. What's Dusk 9?
Dusk 9?
It's nothing. Just a spook story the Imperials concocted to scare us.
I'm not interested in your little ploys, Zane.
I don't care.
You should be.
Next to the Emperor's location, Dusk 9 is the Empire's best-kept secret. Hundreds of black ops projects are born there.
It's also a prison, according to the rumors. The things that supposedly go on there.... Too horrible to be real.
We're more interested in the intel hoarded there. We seeded thousands of bugged soldiers into the Imperial penal system, hoping for a bite.
The Deadeyes are one of the Republic's top sniper squads. Couldn't you have found someone less valuable?
What a waste of talent.
We thought their notoriety might earn them a ticket to Dusk 9. We were mistaken.
Why so many soldiers?
Thousands?
To improve our odds, naturally. The more soldiers we seed, the better our chances of someone winding up at Dusk 9.
That still doesn't explain what you're doing here.
So why are you here?
After many, many failed attempts to get one of our soldiers into Dusk 9, I had an epiphany.
We were using the wrong bait. The brass at Dusk 9 weren't interested in common soldiers--but how could they resist an SIS agent?
So I bugged myself, staged a bogus rescue operation, and let myself be captured. I was awaiting transfer when you two geniuses showed up.
You can still go on with your mission.
Our arrival changes nothing.
You don't think the Imperials will be just a teensy-bit suspicious that you rescued the Deadeyes, yet conveniently left me behind?
If you had kept us in the loop, we could have coordinated this better.
You should have told us.
And what, hope you wouldn't say anything?
You'd already agreed to rescue the Deadeyes once they were captured. Were you just planning on backing out?
And the Deadeyes?
A failed rescue mission was the perfect ruse to get me in. Far more productive than an actual rescue attempt.
Now I have no choice but to abort my mission and try again somewhere else.
Sir, we can deal with Zane later. Let's just find the rest of the squad and get out of here.
Jorgan... sir... they're dead. The cold--they didn't make it.
What? Trace, Koplin--they're gone? But I thought--Zane!
Take it easy, Jorgan....
Calm down.
We don't have time for this. Double-time it, Soldier!
You can be mad later.
Stay out of this, sir.
Now you've done it.
You're in trouble now, Zane.
What? It's not my fault they weren't properly insulated.
You killed them. You promised them a rescue that never came. And now they're dead for it.
How many other soldiers have died for you, huh? A hundred? A thousand?
You can't kill me, Jorgan. Too many witnesses.
Far as we're concerned, sir, the Imperials killed him.
What? Wait, you can't just--! Major! Do something!
What? Wait, you can't just--! Colonel! Do something!
What? Wait, you can't just--! You there! Do something!
Put the gun down, Jorgan. Zane has a lot to answer for, but this isn't the way.
Don't do this.
Holster that weapon, soldier, before I have you thrown in the brig.
Stand down, Jorgan!
Fine. He's not worth it, anyway.
Much obliged.
As for you... you think you can pull a blaster on me and walk away? I'll see you in prison for that.
You'll have every soldier in the Republic gunning for you if this gets out.
No, you won't.
You think anyone will believe a lying worm like you over the most decorated squad in the Republic?
It's your word against ours.
The squad who pulled your ungrateful butt out of an Imperial labor camp, no less.
One word about this to anyone and I'll kill you myself.
Do it and you die.
I... right. Consider my lips sealed.
Let's get these men back to their squad. I'll call for an evac.
He's all yours, Jorgan.
I'll just watch him kill you.
No--!
You here to get us out?
